cl.comment: Cloud area fraction for each layer of atmosphere

emidms.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emiisop.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

emimono.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

emioa.long_name: primary emission and chemical production of dry aerosol organic matter
emioa.comment: This is the sum of total emission of POA and total production of SOA (emipoa+chepsoa). ''Mass'' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.  Integrate 3D chemical production and emission field vertically to 2d field.

emiss.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

sfdms.long_name: DMS volume mixing ratio in surface layer
sfdms.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

sfisop.long_name: Isoprene volume mixing ratio in surface layer
sfisop.comment: Mole fraction of isoprene in air.

sfmmrbc.long_name: Elemental carbon mass mixing ratio in surface layer
sfmmrbc.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. Aerosol takes up ambient water (a process known as hygroscopic growth) depending on the relative humidity and the composition of the aerosol. 'Dry aerosol particles' means aerosol particles without any water uptake. Chemically, 'elemental carbon' is the carbonaceous fraction of particulate matter that is thermally stable in an inert atmosphere to high temperatures near 4000K and can only be gasified by oxidation starting at temperatures above 340 C. It is assumed to be inert and non-volatile under atmospheric conditions and insoluble in any solvent (Ogren and Charlson, 1983).

sfmmrdustabv1.long_name: Dust aerosol mass mixing ratio in surface layer, in particles above 1um diameter
sfmmrdustabv1.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. Aerosol particles take up ambient water (a process known as hygroscopic growth) depending on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles. 'Dry aerosol particles' means aerosol particles without any water uptake.

sfmmrdustabv10.long_name: Dust aerosol mass mixing ratio in surface layer, in particles above 10um diameter
sfmmrdustabv10.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. Aerosol particles take up ambient water (a process known as hygroscopic growth) depending on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles. 'Dry aerosol particles' means aerosol particles without any water uptake.

sfmmrdustbel1.long_name: Dust aerosol mass mixing ratio in surface layer, in particles below 1um diameter
sfmmrdustbel1.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. Aerosol particles take up ambient water (a process known as hygroscopic growth) depending on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles. 'Dry aerosol particles' means aerosol particles without any water uptake.

sfmmroa.long_name: Total organic aerosol mass mixing ratio in surface layer
sfmmroa.comment: We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.

sfmmrso4.long_name: Aerosol sulfate mass mixing ratio in surface layer
sfmmrso4.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X).  'Mass_fraction_of_sulfate' means that the mass is expressed as mass of SO4. 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. Aerosol particles take up ambient water (a process known as hygroscopic growth) depending on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles. 'Dry aerosol particles' means aerosol particles without any water uptake.

sfmmrss.long_name: Sea Salt mass mixing ratio in surface layer
sfmmrss.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. Aerosol particles take up ambient water (a process known as hygroscopic growth) depending on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles. 'Dry aerosol particles' means aerosol particles without any water uptake.

sfmono.long_name: Monoterpene volume mixing ratio in surface layer
sfmono.comment: Mole fraction of monoterpene in air.

uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

vas.comment: Northward component of the near surface wind
